QAPair.Question: What is (are) Metatarsal stress fractures - aftercare ?
QAPair.Answer: The metatarsal bones are the long bones in your foot that connect your ankle to your toes. A stress fracture is a break in the bone that happens with repeated injury or stress. Stress fractures are caused by overly stressing the foot when using it in the same way repeatedly. A stress fracture is different from an acute fracture, which is caused by a sudden and traumatic injury.
